author: Prakash Kamat
text:
The security in Goa has been strengthened while police have begun investigating a post-card which threatened Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Defence Minister Manohar Parrikar for their ‘anti-beef’ policies.

Inspector General of Police (Crime and Range) V. Renganathan confirmed the contents of the letter which had IS scribbled on it. He said it is being probed by north Goa police.

Mr. Renganathan said the police had briefed the intelligence agencies at the Centre. Police said Mr. Parrikar’s security was reviewed.
title: Security stepped up in Goa after terror threat
